def.dt: :intelligent and able to learn things quickly A few clever [=smart, bright] students have started a business recycling old computers. Some cats are clever enough to figure out how to operate doorknobs.

:showing intelligent thinking a clever design/invention That's the cleverest idea I've heard yet! She found a clever hiding place for the letter. often used in a joking or ironic way to describe a foolish idea, action, etc. Whose clever idea was it to leave the window open?
:funny in a way that shows intelligence I enjoyed the play's clever [=witty] dialogue.
:talking in a rude way that is meant to show you are smart Don't you start getting clever [=(US) fresh] with me! [=don't speak to me in a disrespectful way]
:good at doing things with your hands :skillful Even as a little boy playing with blocks he was clever with his hands. a clever machinist

dt.un: used in various negative expressions to suggest that someone is not feeling well I'd had a few drinks and wasn't feeling very clever. For someone who hasn't been feeling too clever lately, he just played a great round of golf.

def.dt: :clever in a way that is annoying or that causes problems an arrogant politician who is too clever by half a complex computer program that is too clever by half
:a person who is clever in a way that is annoying called also clever clogs
